alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Big Belt, Bridger and Castle Mountains; Canyon Ferry Area; Cascade County below 5000ft; East Glacier Park Region; Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Eastern Toole and Liberty; Elkhorn and Boulder Mountains; Fergus County below 4500ft; Gallatin Valley; Gates of the Mountains; Helena Valley; Hill County; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains; Madison River Valley; Meagher County Valleys; Missouri Headwaters; Northern High Plains; Snowy and Judith Mountains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front; Upper Blackfoot and MacDonald Pass; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 08 at 1:46PM MST until January 10 at 12:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TUESDAY TO MIDNIGHT MST TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...West winds 30 to 40 mph, with gusts up to 65 mph expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, and southwest Montana. * WHEN...From noon Tuesday to midnight MST Tuesday Night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong winds develop early Tuesday morning along the Rocky Mountian Front and spread east across the north central Montana Plains as well as the higher terrain and north to south oriented valleys of southwest Montana by early Tuesday afternoon. Most areas will see peak wind gusts occur with the passage of a cold front Tuesday afternoon.
info.instruction: People are urged to secure loose objects that could be blown around or damaged by the wind.
